instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3435: What is 820-3435? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.CHGR_CSO_N: What is CHGR_CSO_N? CHGR_CSO_N is one of the current sense lines for the battery. Resistance between CHGR_CSO_N and CHGR_CSO_P should be the resistance should be the total series resistance of the current sense resistors in the circuit, usually about 2.2 ohms.
definitions.CHGR_CSO_P: What is CHGR_CSO_P? CHGR_CSO_P is one of the current sense lines for the battery. Resistance between CHGR_CSO_P and CHGR_CSO_N should be the resistance should be the total series resistance of the current sense resistors in the circuit, usually about 2.2 ohms.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA: What is SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA? SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA is the data line of an I2C data line between the battery charging chip that creates PPBUS_G3H, the system management controller(SMC), the battery, and the battery indicator LED. If this lineâ€™s resistance to ground is too low because of a defective component, battery will not be recognized with an X on the icon and PPBUS_G3H voltage will be lower than it is on a good system..

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A doesn't see battery
threads.message: hello i got macbook air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that doesn't see the battery. Everytime I unplugged the magsafe it shuts off. It looks like my SMC is fried. My diode mode reading on <SIGNAL>CHGR_CSO_N</SIGNAL> - 0.134 & <SIGNAL>CHGR_CSO_P</SIGNAL> - 0.135. I already try replacing it but im still having the same problem. <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> has already been replaced as well. any suggestions?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A doesn't see battery
threads.message: I replaced smc but it still doesn't appear. any ideas?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A doesn't see battery
threads.message: Forgive me here but, have you tried a know good battery?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A doesn't see battery
threads.message:
Is recognized on OS?
Resistance between pins 17/18 from <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>??
Diode mode on data lines from battery conector.??

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A doesn't see battery
threads.message: Yes I did! Still same problem.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A doesn't see battery
threads.message: Bleep out the SDA SCL lines

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A doesn't see battery
threads.message: the battery wasnt been recognize by the OS. During inspection i found the lines <SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA</SIGNAL> & SDL were shorted to ground.  After correcting the bad soldering (pin 10 & 11) on <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> the battery was back in action. i cant believe I miss tis. Thanks for the input guys!
